quotes.text: Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me.
quotes.speaker: Bene Gesserit Litany Against Fear

quotes.text: The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.
quotes.speaker: Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam

quotes.text: A process cannot be understood by stopping it. Understanding must move with the flow of the process, must join it and flow with it.
quotes.speaker: The First Law of Mentat

quotes.text: Deep in the human unconscious is a pervasive need for a logical universe that makes sense. But the real universe is always one step beyond logic.
quotes.speaker: Princess Irulan

quotes.text: The power to destroy a thing is the absolute control over it.
quotes.speaker: Paul Muad'Dib

quotes.text: What do you despise? By this are you truly known.
quotes.speaker: Princess Irulan

quotes.text: Once men turned their thinking over to machines in the hope that this would set them free. But that only permitted other men with machines to enslave them.
quotes.speaker: Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam

quotes.text: There is no escape—we pay for the violence of our ancestors.
quotes.speaker: Paul Atreides

quotes.text: When religion and politics travel in the same cart, the riders believe nothing can stand in their way.
quotes.speaker: Bene Gesserit Proverb

quotes.text: Arrakis teaches the attitude of the knife - chopping off what's incomplete and saying: 'Now, it's complete because it's ended here.'
quotes.speaker: Muad'Dib

quotes.text: Some men are born to lead as others are born to follow.
quotes.speaker: Leto Atreides I

quotes.text: Knowing where the trap is—that's the first step in evading it.
quotes.speaker: Duke Leto Atreides

quotes.text: The mind commands the body and it obeys. The mind orders itself and meets resistance.
quotes.speaker: Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam

quotes.text: The willow submits to the wind and prospers until one day it is many willows — a wall against the wind.
quotes.speaker: Muad'Dib

quotes.text: There is probably no more terrible instant of enlightenment than the one in which you discover your father is a man — with human flesh.
quotes.speaker: Dune Messiah

quotes.text: The highest function of ecology is understanding consequences.
quotes.speaker: Pardot Kynes

quotes.text: To suspect your own mortality is to know the beginning of terror; to learn irrefutably that you are mortal is to know the end of terror.
quotes.speaker: Muad'Dib

quotes.text: Governments, if they endure, always tend increasingly toward aristocratic forms. No government in history has been known to evade this pattern.
quotes.speaker: Children of Dune

quotes.text: The person who experiences greatness must have a feeling for the myth he is in. He must reflect what is projected upon him.
quotes.speaker: Paul Muad'Dib

quotes.text: Most civilizations are just a mixture of things, a collection of shadows from many places, from things that once were powerful.
quotes.speaker: Leto Atreides II
